channel.title: Breaking Bad discussion (Spoilers inside)
channel.description: The last episode of this season of breaking bad... hank finally starts to put it together... what a way to end it. I can't wait til next season starts up (it HAS to be the last season of the show). they left us all hanging with this one!

item.title: Breaking Bad discussion (Spoilers inside)
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

It was such a great ending. The look on Lydia’s face left me elated - there’s nothing quite like an antagonist knowing they’re going to die, before they die, and yet still being so powerless to stop it.

Also:

item.title: Breaking Bad discussion (Spoilers inside)
item.dc:creator: @EMINEM_BEAST EMINEM BEAST™
item.description:
@EMINEM_BEAST wrote:

Spoiler
I’m kind of late to discuss this episode so I wont bore people by repeating the same shit about how incredible the montages were (by far some of the best directing and editing EVER fucking seen on TV. Honestly, that prison montage while Walt was walking around checking the time, knowing with every second that passed another man was dead because of him, was definitely a homage to the Godfather baptism scene), how Jesse being scared of Walt just shows how much their relationship has diminished, Walt mocking Lydia about killing her but having the ricin with him anyways, and the incredible connections made to previous episodes (the painting, Walt’s scan (last time he had a scan in season 4 they didn’t show the results and he just tells his family that it was okay, I’ve been saying that his cancers been back since then for like the last year), the RV, the paper towel dispenser, Walt taking a shower, the fly…holy shit).

What I will say though is that the level of symbolism, foreshadowing and allusions in this show are almost beyond ANY novel I’ve ever read. The painting, when he first saw it after his fugue state, clearly represented a man leaving his family and just traveling farther away literally and emotionally. Now it makes another appearance just as Walt plans to further darken his soul and kill 10 men…in less than 2 minutes, Michael Corleone doesn’t have shit on Walter White…

But it doesn’t stop there…The title of this episode, “Gliding Over All”, is a Walt Whitman poem that mentions the voyage of the soul and a setting sail…Coincidence? Nah…And ON TOP OF THAT, this is the episode where Lydia mentions the plan to expand OVERSEAS, literally making Walt set sail on a voyage…

If that wasn’t enough, when Walt sees the painting he mentions something about how he wonders if all these paintings just sit in some warehouse somewhere…which made me think of the warehouse in the promo pic, but instead in a few minutes we see Skyler take him to a warehouse and show him all the money he’s earned…

This is by far one of the most incredible shows of all time

Read full topic

item.title: Breaking Bad discussion (Spoilers inside)
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:14, topic:458110”][quote author=Team_Rocket link=topic=561035.msg4095133#msg4095133 date=1346756832]

Then again, W.W. is a brilliant criminal mastermind. He never would’ve goofed up the whacking in N.Y.C. that got Tony Montana clipped.

he’s a terrible criminal mastermind,

once jesse finds out he poisoned brock, shit will hit the fan
once jesse finds out he let jane die, shit will hit the fan
once jesse finds out he killed mike, shit will hit the fan

when discussing heisenburg with hank over a family dinner walt, while drunk, says something along the lines of “maybe your guy is still out there”

g.b and todd both kept notes and it’s going to land walter in a world of shit as is the case with g.b currently

how he’s managed to get this far without being caught is amazing

All true, however, Jesse is disposable.
[/quote]

nooooo :eek:

he’s just a good of a cook as walt without as much of the character flaws (at this point) and they have ridiculous history at this point for walt to kill jesse

What is breaking bad. Going to watch it now

god don’t read this thread go watch it[/quote]

Honestly from the way the show is headed, Jesse might be the only one who actually walks away. Look at how much he’s cleaned up his act and is thinking. When Walt and Mike were arguing over their cut - Jesse offered them all of his money to prevent an altercation.

Read full topic
